comments:
R1.0, build 137 (Win2K) 

Use the Manifest editor to create a "Project Natures" extension, and its 
"runtime", and get XML like this: 

<extension
      id="test"
      name="Just a Test"
      point="org.eclipse.core.resources.natures">
   <runtime
         class="PluginFooBar.ProjectNature1">
   </runtime>
</extension>

However, the correct XML is like this: 

<extension
      id="test"
      name="Just a Test"
      point="org.eclipse.core.resources.natures">
   <runtime>
         <run class="PluginFooBar.ProjectNature1"/>
   </runtime>
</extension>

And the project nature will not be created (since its class will never get 
called) and you will get a callstack with this at the top: 

org.eclipse.core.runtime.CoreException: Executable extension definition for
run not found.
 at
org.eclipse.core.internal.plugins.ConfigurationElement.createExecutableExtension
(ConfigurationElement.java:70)

 at
org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Project.createNature(Project.java:341)

This is a known bug that has been fixed in 2.0 stream. As a workaround, repair 
your XML manually in the source page.

traces.message: Executable extension definition for run not found.
